requirements.text: Fix the jigsaw puzzle interaction so it is playable (pieces can be picked up, dragged, and dropped reliably) on both desktop and touch devices.

quotes: Yes total correct make puzzle playable

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop: clicking/tapping a piece starts dragging it; moving the pointer moves the piece; releasing drops it and ends dragging.
On mobile/touch: touch drag works equivalently (no dependency on mouse-only events).
Dragging does not scroll the page while interacting with the canvas/puzzle area.
Dropping a piece near its correct slot snaps it into place as before.
Users can complete the puzzle end-to-end without getting stuck due to missing/failed input handling.

requirements.text: Ensure the post-puzzle experience remains unchanged: completing the puzzle triggers the existing completion behavior and reveals the existing Valentine message after completion (no copy changes to the revealed message).

quotes: On the site yes after the puzzle

acceptanceCriteria: When the puzzle becomes fully completed, the completion callback fires and the message reveal section displays as it does currently.
The revealed Valentine message text remains exactly as currently implemented in the message reveal component (no edits to that message content).

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; do not introduce new backend services or external dependencies.
Do not route images through the backend; continue using static assets from frontend/public when needed.
nonGoals: Do not change the main page greeting, header title, footer credit, or overall Valentine theme styling beyond what is necessary to make the puzzle playable.
Do not add a new game type; keep it as the same jigsaw-style puzzle (only fix playability and change the puzzle text).
